item.title: Ipod Video Vs. PSP
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

iPod, if I wanted to get online, I would use my computer. I can watch videos, listen to music, read my text files, and basically do all of the things I want to do while I’m on the go. It’s meant for on-the-go entertainment.

Read full topic

item.title: Ipod Video Vs. PSP
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I own both, and, I don’t believe you should put PSP and Ipod in the same category. The psp does have some nice features, as well as some drawbacks, but all around, it’s a good gaming system for what it does. The Ipod is an amazing pieve of technology, it plays Music, some games, videos, etc. But there are drawbacks to it. They both are good if you’re searching for something in that field. But, I personally like my ipod more, or well, I use my ipod more, but, I like the sexyness of my psp.

Read full topic

item.title: Ipod Video Vs. PSP
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Doc. Booty, post:19, topic:9108”][quote author=googlethis link=topic=12978.msg166176#msg166176 date=1155951837]
I don’t even see how you can compare the two. And also, iPod owns PSP because you can install Linux on iPods.
[/quote]
You can install Vista on a PSP. PWNDKTHX?[/quote]
Vista sucks! Lol, anyways, yeah… They are a lot different than eachother… but If you want to compare them then I suppose I’ll have to go with the PSP as you can connect to wireless hotspots and private wireless routers, also if you get the right firmware you can run homebrew software (as I’m aware you SORTOF can on an iPod… like iPod linux). Another program that you can get that I like for psp’s is a VNC client which lets you connect to your computers VNC through your wireless in your house and lets you control you’re computer from… lets say the toilet :).

Anyway, I have both a PSP and an iPod and yes as other people have said, I absolutely love them both.

Read full topic
